name: month-day-year Date
description: Matches a date in the m/d/y format with "/", "-", "." and " " as possible delimiters
content:
This pattern is looking for dates in the following formats:
mm/dd/yyyy or m/d/yy like 12/25/2014 or 5/8/14 but also 5/8/2014
mm-dd-yyyy or m-d-yy like 12-25-2014 or 5-8-14 but also 5-8-2014
mm.dd.yyyy or m-d-yy like 12.25.2014 or 5.8.14 but also 5.8.2014
mm dd yyyy or m-d-yy like 12 25 2014 or 5 8 14 but also 5 8 2014

It requires consistency for the two separators.
It does not validate dates other than keeping 'mm' within the range [1 - 12] and 'dd' within [1 - 31].
It does not check for leap years either as IMHO, you should not do that with regex.

Some Dates:
12/25/2014 is valid
12/13/2014 is valid
8/21/14    is valid
8/21/2014  is valid
13/12/2014 is not valid in the "m/d/y" format

12-25-2014 is valid
12-13-2014 is valid
8-21-14    is valid
8-21-2014  is valid
13-12-2014 is not valid in the "m-d-y" format

12.25.2014 is valid
12.13.2014 is valid
8.21.14    is valid
8.21.2014  is valid
13.12.2014 is not valid in the "m.d.y" format

12 25 2014 is valid
12 13 2014 is valid
8 21 14    is valid
8 21 2014  is valid
13 12 2014 is not valid in the "m d y" format

12/25-2014 is not valid
12-13.2014 is not valid
8.21 14    is not valid


Sample text for testing:
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ
0123456789 +-.,!@#$%^&*();\/|<>"'
12345 -98.7 3.141 .6180 9,000 +42
555.123.4567	+1-(800)-555-2468
foo@demo.net	bar.ba@test.co.uk
www.demo.com	http://foo.co.uk/
http://regexr.com/foo.html?q=bar
author: YeO
